channel.title: S3 on nanta - Data Engineering
channel.description: Recent content in S3 on nanta - Data Engineering

item.title: BigQuery Data Transfer + Airflow: Why We Create and Delete Transfers Every Batch
item.description: We built a pipeline to load S3 mart tables into BigQuery using Data Transfer Service. During PoC, DTS scheduling was managed by GCP. For production, we moved it into Airflow — creating a transfer object each batch tick and deleting it after completion. User feedback drove improvements: multi-day lookback windows, concurrent execution quota management via slot pools, and empty source path detection through GCP logging API.

item.title: S3 Table Buckets PoC: Evaluating Managed Iceberg for CDC Workloads
item.description: AWS S3 Table Buckets offer managed Iceberg tables with automatic compaction. We ran a PoC to see if they could solve our CDC table compaction problem. We validated Trino, Spark, and Kafka Connect integration, examined auto-compaction behavior, and assessed costs. The conclusion: not a fit for every table, but valuable specifically for CDC workloads with unpredictable partition-level updates.

item.title: Trino Alluxio Cache PoC: EBS Throughput Was the Bottleneck
item.description: We ran a PoC of Trino’s Alluxio-based file system cache in a production OLAP environment. Adding the cache alone didn’t help much. The default EBS throughput of 125 MiB/s was the bottleneck. After bumping it to 1000 MiB/s, query performance improved visibly and S3 API costs dropped by ~$3,200/month.
